intro: Gurania wawraei var. trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed gurania, is a rare and intriguing plant native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red, with a distinctive three-lobed shape that sets it apart from other members of its genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
